ygData.subject: Re: Limit on song memorization
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Every caster class has this problem actually. Yes i think we could use at least a couple more slots for songs. I don t think bards have it quite as bad as
ygData.messageBody:
>From: Tom Reece <bamadude@...>
>
>Does anyone think that bards should not be limited to memorizing only
>eight songs at a time? I just made 20th level and for the first time
>had to think really hard on what songs I wanted to memorize. I don't
>think the spellcasting classes really have much of a problem with >this.

Every caster class has this problem actually. Yes i think we could use at
least a couple more slots for songs. I don't think bards have it quite as
bad as Shamans though - they have a SLEW of AWESOME buff spells and if they
want to uber-buff party members they normally end up switching spells out
EVERY time they buff. That would terribly irritate me.

>I can safely say that I will almost always have Selos and Hymn of
>Restoration memorized. Anthem or Warsong is another automatic. That
>leaves me with 5 slots for all the remaining 18 songs I know. If the
>choice is hard now, I can't imagine what its like later on down the
>road.

>Galtin of E'ci

I still manage and don't really have any problem with song selection at 37.
I have Selo's memmed when outdoors, but will swap it with Pixie Strike or
something while indoors. Hymn of Restoration is pretty much obsolete if you
are grouped with healers and have mana song. Now that I have Celerity and
stack it with Chant of Battle I never touch Bellows.

Sartori D'Elsiraad
Bard of Kelethin of the 37th Chorus
Veeshan
